message.raw:
Remove tab icon and color setting timer. This timer was intended to ensure
that icons and colours were set eventually even if the tab was in mid-drag
and thus not in a notebook (and thus not having a tab handle).

This is no longer needed as the new dragdroptabs implementation has the tab
always in a notebook, even in mid-drag.

Remove some commented out code.
message.html:

that icons and colours were set eventually even if the tab was in mid-drag
and thus not in a notebook (and thus not having a tab handle).

This is no longer needed as the new dragdroptabs implementation has the tab
always in a notebook, even in mid-drag.

Remove some commented out code.

message.raw:
Remove --delay from restarting. It is no longer needed as the server is now
cleanly shut down and does not rely on the process ending for the port
to be freed. Removing the --delay makes the restart arguments identical to
the arguments that initially started the program, which makes Windows recognize
BLACS as BLACS, rather than displaying the wrong icon in the taskbar.
message.html:
Remove --delay from restarting. It is no longer needed as the server is now
cleanly shut down and does not rely on the process ending for the port
to be freed. Removing the --delay makes the restart arguments identical to
the arguments that initially started the program, which makes Windows recognize
BLACS as BLACS, rather than displaying the wrong icon in the taskbar.

values.message:
Remove --delay from restarting. It is no longer needed as the server is now
cleanly shut down and does not rely on the process ending for the port
to be freed. Removing the --delay makes the restart arguments identical to
the arguments that initially started the program, which makes Windows recognize
BLACS as BLACS, rather than displaying the wrong icon in the taskbar.

message.raw:
Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress
bar looking the same on all platforms. Set text alignment to center so
that test is in the bar even if the style fails to be set, otherwise things
look silly.
message.html:
Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress
bar looking the same on all platforms. Set text alignment to center so
that test is in the bar even if the style fails to be set, otherwise things
look silly.

Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress

look silly.

values.message:
Use "Fusion" or "Plastique" (if Qt4) style to get readable text in the progress
bar looking the same on all platforms. Set text alignment to center so
that test is in the bar even if the style fails to be set, otherwise things
look silly.

message.raw:
Do not depend on newer labscript_devices to see if wait done events are
supported, instead inspect a connection table property supports_wait_completed_events
of the wait monitor device. If not present, treat it as False. If the events
are not supported, then just skip over waits as if they last 0.1 seconds.
Display an icon as a warning in this case, with a tooltip explaining this.
Move GUI into a separate file now that there is more than a single widget.
message.html:
Do not depend on newer labscript_devices to see if wait done events are
supported, instead inspect a connection table property supports_wait_completed_events
of the wait monitor device. If not present, treat it as False. If the events
are not supported, then just skip over waits as if they last 0.1 seconds.
Display an icon as a warning in this case, with a tooltip explaining this.
Move GUI into a separate file now that there is more than a single widget.

message.raw:
Change queue prepending mechanism for a priority system instead.
The queue now has a sort order, first by priority, then by order tasks
were added. Instead of queue.put(..., prepend=True), one can now call
queue.put(..., priority=-1). Default priority is zero, so negative numbers
indicate earlier execution and higher numbers later execution.
message.html:
Change queue prepending mechanism for a priority system instead.
The queue now has a sort order, first by priority, then by order tasks
were added. Instead of queue.put(..., prepend=True), one can now call
queue.put(..., priority=-1). Default priority is zero, so negative numbers
indicate earlier execution and higher numbers later execution.

indicate earlier execution and higher numbers later execution.

message.raw:
Move starting of worker process into state machine mainloop prior to
'init' being called, so that it doesn't occur in the GUI thread and doesn't
hang the GUI.
message.html:
Move starting of worker process into state machine mainloop prior to
'init' being called, so that it doesn't occur in the GUI thread and doesn't
hang the GUI.

hang the GUI.

message.raw:
Start worker processes in the order they are called from the GUI initialisation
method.
When restarting or closing tabs, do not terminate processes that were never
started, this results in an exception that crashes BLACS.
message.html:
Start worker processes in the order they are called from the GUI initialisation
method.
When restarting or closing tabs, do not terminate processes that were never
started, this results in an exception that crashes BLACS.

message.raw:
Defer starting the worker process until _initialise_worker. This way,
import errors/syntax errors etc in deferred worker class imports can be handled
with the normal state machine machinery and seen by the user.
message.html:
Defer starting the worker process until _initialise_worker. This way,
import errors/syntax errors etc in deferred worker class imports can be handled
with the normal state machine machinery and seen by the user.

message.raw:
Only set up excepthook in child process, not in parent. This way merely importing
the base class won't set up the excepthook, only running a worker will.

Only set up excepthook in child process, not in parent. This way merely importing
the base class won't set up the excepthook, only running a worker will.

message.raw:
Add functionality for passing in import paths to worker classes instead
of the worker classes themselves, so that the parent process can avoid
running unnecessary imports.

Bump minor version so that Tab classes can depend on this.

message.raw:
Added priorities for plugin callbacks. Plugin callbacks may now be decorated
with the decorator `blacs.plugins.callback(priority=<number>)`, and those with
the lowest number for their priority will be called first. The defauly priority
is 10, which will be used if no priority is specified or if a callback does not
use this decorator. Because it is optional, this change is backward compatible
with existing callbacks, which will work unmodified. I have not added the
decorator to any of the callbacks of the plugins shipped with BLACS.

This functionality was implemented by defining a Callback class in blacs.plugins
that has an attribute for the priority, but is also a callable, and so can be
just called as normal if the priority is not relevant.

Moved `get_callbacks()` from `blacs.experiment_queue` into `blacs.plugins`, and
modified it to return callbacks in order of priority. Removed the `inmain`
decorator from it since it should not normally need to touch the GUI - if a
plugin needs to touch the GUI to get callbacks for whatever reason, it can call
`inmain()` itself.

Replaced the remaining code in the
queue manager that manually looked through plugins for callbacks with
a call to get_callbacks.

This is so that I can make a plugin with a callback for 'shot_complete', which
delays the start of the next shot. This callback should run last if there are
other callbacks, necessitating priorities of some sort.

use this decorator. Because it is optional, this change is backward compatible
with existing callbacks, which will work unmodified. I have not added the
decorator to any of the callbacks of the plugins shipped with BLACS.

other callbacks, necessitating priorities of some sort.

Added priorities for plugin callbacks. Plugin callbacks may now be decorated
with the decorator blacs.plugins.callback(priority=<number>), and those with
the lowest number for their priority will be called first. The defauly priority
is 10, which will be used if no priority is specified or if a callback does not
use this decorator. Because it is optional, this change is backward compatible
with existing callbacks, which will work unmodified. I have not added the
decorator to any of the callbacks of the plugins shipped with BLACS.

that has an attribute for the priority, but is also a callable, and so can be
just called as normal if the priority is not relevant.

Moved get_callbacks() from blacs.experiment_queue into blacs.plugins, and
modified it to return callbacks in order of priority. Removed the inmain
decorator from it since it should not normally need to touch the GUI - if a
plugin needs to touch the GUI to get callbacks for whatever reason, it can call

values.message:
Added priorities for plugin callbacks. Plugin callbacks may now be decorated
with the decorator `blacs.plugins.callback(priority=<number>)`, and those with
the lowest number for their priority will be called first. The defauly priority
is 10, which will be used if no priority is specified or if a callback does not
use this decorator. Because it is optional, this change is backward compatible
with existing callbacks, which will work unmodified. I have not added the
decorator to any of the callbacks of the plugins shipped with BLACS.

This functionality was implemented by defining a Callback class in blacs.plugins
that has an attribute for the priority, but is also a callable, and so can be
just called as normal if the priority is not relevant.

Moved `get_callbacks()` from `blacs.experiment_queue` into `blacs.plugins`, and
modified it to return callbacks in order of priority. Removed the `inmain`
decorator from it since it should not normally need to touch the GUI - if a
plugin needs to touch the GUI to get callbacks for whatever reason, it can call
`inmain()` itself.

Replaced the remaining code in the
queue manager that manually looked through plugins for callbacks with
a call to get_callbacks.

This is so that I can make a plugin with a callback for 'shot_complete', which
delays the start of the next shot. This callback should run last if there are
other callbacks, necessitating priorities of some sort.

message.raw:
Fixed a bug where the save data for the console was not being stored on tab restart.

We now have a new method in the Tab bas class called `get_all_save_data()` which collates the save data from `Tab.get_builtin_save_data` and the `get_save_data` method of a subclass (if it exists).
We also fix a bug which causes blacs to crash on exit if the return value of `get_save_data()` was not a dictionary.
We also change the order in which the dictionary gets updated so that subclasses can override the restore behaviour of the worker terminal if they wish (but it's discouraged via the use of the underscore prepending the dictionary keys).
The front panel settings saving code is also now simplified to make use of these changes!

This fixes issue #47 and results in a bump of the patch version to 2.3.1
message.html:
Fixed a bug where the save data for the console was not being stored on tab restart.

We now have a new method in the Tab bas class called get_all_save_data() which collates the save data from Tab.get_builtin_save_data and the get_save_data method of a subclass (if it exists).
We also fix a bug which causes blacs to crash on exit if the return value of get_save_data() was not a dictionary.
We also change the order in which the dictionary gets updated so that subclasses can override the restore behaviour of the worker terminal if they wish (but it's discouraged via the use of the underscore prepending the dictionary keys).
The front panel settings saving code is also now simplified to make use of these changes!

This fixes issue #47 and results in a bump of the patch version to 2.3.1

We also fix a bug which causes blacs to crash on exit if the return value of get_save_data() was not a dictionary.

values.message:
Fixed a bug where the save data for the console was not being stored on tab restart.

We now have a new method in the Tab bas class called `get_all_save_data()` which collates the save data from `Tab.get_builtin_save_data` and the `get_save_data` method of a subclass (if it exists).
We also fix a bug which causes blacs to crash on exit if the return value of `get_save_data()` was not a dictionary.
We also change the order in which the dictionary gets updated so that subclasses can override the restore behaviour of the worker terminal if they wish (but it's discouraged via the use of the underscore prepending the dictionary keys).
The front panel settings saving code is also now simplified to make use of these changes!

This fixes issue #47 and results in a bump of the patch version to 2.3.1
